result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:38 PM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Robert S David appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody, Attorney Gary R Schmaus appeared in court for Robert S David.  Counsel advises is prepared to waive prelim, but does not have completed form.  Court orally examines defendant on waiver of preliminary hearing, accepts said waiver, and binds matter over for trial. State files the information. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea.
Further proceedings scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Further proceedings on April 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Counsel advises has not met with Defendant and requests additional status on prelim. Court finds good cause to extend time limits.
Status hearing scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on February 8, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. Not to enter any pharmacy while case is pending.

1:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Robert S David appeared by video from Ozaukee County Jail, Attorney Heather Dvoran appeared as a friend of the court for Robert S David. Defendant in custody. Counsel acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading. Court reviews charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State requesting $5000 cash bail with conditions. Court finds good cause to waive time limits.
Arraignment scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 08:15 am.
